text: Claude Nelson Warren (March 18, 1932 - November 4, 2021) was an American anthropologist. His works focused on early humans in the Far West such as in the California Desert. He helped define San Dieguito and La Jolla complexes. Warren worked at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. He was born in Goldendale, Washington. Warren died on November 4, 2021 in Las Vegas, Nevada at the age of 89.Claude Nelson Warren ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American anthropologists Category:Academics from Nevada Category:Writers from Washington (state) Category:Writers from Las Vegas Category:Scientists from Nevada Category:Scientists from Washington (state) Category:Educators from Las Vegas
title: Claude Nelson Warren
